english: to prop/support; to hold up; to be overstuffed; to sustain

etymology.interpretation: The hand element indicates a manual action such as holding or propping something up. The phonetic 牚 supplies the pronunciation cheng and also historically relates to the idea of propping or supporting, reinforcing the meaning.
etymology.simplification: The traditional right-side phonetic 牚 was replaced by a streamlined form in 撑, reducing strokes while preserving the left-hand semantic 扌 and the pronunciation chēng.

examples.chinese: 他用木棍把门撑住(他用木棍把門撐住)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng mùgùn bǎ mén chēng zhù.
examples.english: He used a stick to prop the door open.

examples.chinese: 饭吃太多，我都撑了(飯吃太多，我都撐了)。
examples.pinyin: Fàn chī tài duō, wǒ dōu chēng le.
examples.english: I ate too much and feel overstuffed.

examples.chinese: 雨下得很大，他赶紧撑伞(雨下得很大，他趕緊撐傘)。
examples.pinyin: Yǔ xià de hěn dà, tā gǎnjǐn chēng sǎn.
examples.english: It was raining hard, and he quickly opened his umbrella.
